comment: Prof. Stephens was one of the best professors I had at KSU. Her class was VERY hard but she made it clear what the test would have on it and the types of questions she would ask. You HAVE to put the effort in or your grade will suffer, but she gave 40 whole points of bonus by the end of the semester. All of her material is easy to access too.

she isn't that great for lecture. she's VERY strict in terms of knowing the information. she makes the tests herself so you can't cheat! i had a VERY hard time in her class. her tests are extremely hard (5 tests that are worth 80% of your grade) i wouldn't recommend her for lecture. she also hardly gave out any extra credit either :( please avoid!

she's perfect for lab! i would recommend her to everyone i know! she makes lab so easy! i made a B, but if i would've worked a tad bit harder, i would've gotten an A! please please please take her for a&p 2 lab! i promise you that she will not disappoint! she's always available if you have any questions! i absolutely loved her! a literal gem!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: She is a very knowledgeable professor and knows her stuff. I took her online so classes were based on her powerpoints no need for the book really. Test are based on powerpoints as well. But the class is HARD non the less and tests are NOT easy and you cant google it, she makes the tests herself.

Awful. She will give you a "study guide" but will tell you that she will not teach all the matireal. She only teaches about half and sometimes during classs will spend a whole lecture teaching on a topic to end the class with "this will not be on the exam". Stay away and save yourself. I am a straight A student at KSU and she said my C was great.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Look no further. This is the best possible Anatomy & Physiology teacher you could ever sign up for. I have nothing else to say besides, TAKE THIS CLASS. She is passionate and caring. You will never regret it, ever.

Stephens and Haack are by far the best anatomy professors at KSU. Great at explaining, gives tons of feedback, and replies fast. Anatomy is very hard, but if you put in the work needed, you'll get an A. She gave us a total of 55 extra credit points for the semester. Very funny and a solid professor.

By far the best professor I have ever had! She truly cares about her students and is willing to help outside of class. Does multiple review sessions for the test and responds to emails very quickly. You definitely have to put in work for this class or you wont pass. If you study A LOT you will be fine. You wont regret taking her. Amazing!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Anatomy is already such a hard class, but Professor Stephens is extremely fair. She is the best professor to take for both A&P I and II. You have to put in the work to make an A, but it is possible.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: my favorite professor EVER! The material is not easy but she explains in an easy way. She really wants her students to succeed. But if you are lazy and doesn't want to put some work you won't pass
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: After taking Prof. Stephens for both AP 1 and 2, I can say that she is your best choice. The class itself is hard and challenging but shes going to make sure all of her students are successful. You just have to go to class, participate, and study. Her test are difficult but they are a great prep for the actual nursing program!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: She is the best professor out there for A&P2! Take her you and you wont regret it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Took this lab during corona and it was straightforward. Attendance was mandatory and the tests were straightforward. Other assignments were given so if you didn't do well on one test, you will get an A. Lab was way easier than lecture. Professor Stephens was an amazing lab professor and I ended up learning a lot in her lab and lecture. 10/10

I took this class over the summer during corona and it was extremely fast. I think there were 5 tests and they were very hard. Questions were made for you to think. Her tests are not unfair, they are just very detailed. As long as you take detailed notes, listen during lecture, do the HW, and study everyday you will earn the grade you want.

Professor Stephens knows her stuff and cares about her students success and understanding of the material. She has challenging exams that are designed to make you think, as it is important to understand how the body works if you desire to be a medical professional.

Is A&P II hard? VERY. But as she says in her syllabus, don't confuse HARD for UNFAIR. I took this in the summer, basically at warp speed. Her tests are hard and will make you think, but prepare you for the NCLEX and nursing school. Do the work, a lot of work, and you can EARN an A. She's my favorite professor I've ever had.

She's pretty chill. A&P is a hard class but she knows her stuff. Just gotta be willing to put in the time for her class. All tests are multiple-choice but beware she likes tricky MC questions. Lets you record lectures and is pretty accessible over email. Really cares about her kids and wants you to succeed. Just gotta be willing to work for it.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I took her for A&P 2 LAB. She is the best professor I have ever had in lab. She sits down and explains things in a simple way. She really goes out her way to make sure everyone is comfortable with the information, even is she has to stay over class time with you and work on certain things. Take her if you get the chance!!
Gives extra credit throughout the course, but refuses to round up any grade at the end of the semester. Overall, extremely nice and helpful but hard class.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: By far the best professor I've ever had! This class is hard, really hard. If you don't look at the material daily, you'll have a hard time keeping up with the class. She cares a lot and is always willing to help and inspire students with classwork and beyond. She gives multiple opportunities for extra credit. Tests are hard, so work for it!

Professor Stephens is an amazing professor, but this class is hard. Be prepared to work your butt off. This class requires time and dedication. You have Mastering assignments, 5 tests, and a few assignments worth 20 points or less. The tests are very hard but she provides objectives, but you really need to know your stuff.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: A&P is indeed a difficult class, there is so much material to be covered at once. Professor Stephens explains everything so vividly and literally explains everything she expects of you. She is always willing to help you and improve your grades, just communicate with her! Complete the objectives and homework, and communicate with her!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures

comment: AP is a difficult class, but Professor Stephens does a great job at teaching it. Theres 4 test , and a few homework assignments. Her test are a little hard, but theyre straightforward. She gives all the info. you need, all you have to do is study. She truly cares about her students and is easily accessible.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures

comment: Awesome Professor, very caring & will do anything to help get you where you need to be to do well. Tests are challenging, which is why people say shes hard. However, she gives a list of objectives & if you complete & study then, record & listen to her lectures you are bound to do well! Go to class & study hard & youll do great!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Stephens is a very sweet lady who is willing to help you succeed in any way she can. This course in general is a very tough class that requires a lot of studying on your own. Her powerpoints give you all the information you need for the tests. She does her part, so your grade completely depends on your effort.

Definitely choose this professor. She is extremely knowledgeable on the subject and willing to help in almost anyway she can. COMMUNICATE with her and she will work with you. Study your objectives and you will do fine. The course is difficult all on its own, but professor Stephens does her best to help make it possible.

Some reviews are obviously by people who dont want to work to make the grade they want. They obviously wanted an easy grade in a hard class. Yes, the tests are difficult but if you study the power points you will do fine. If you are serious about learning and want to be the best nurse you can, TAKE HER. Plenty of people made an A or B.

Retook A&P 2 after getting a C the first time. I got a 99 when I took it with Stephens because I was highly motivated, read the textbook, took notes, and took advantage of the Pearson resources. If you are serious about nursing, learning everything that you can is important. The exams have a level of detail that appreciate hard studying.

I think these reviews are too harsh. This class is difficult, and she makes you work for your grade, but she will do everything in her power to help you succeed. She was always available outside of class to meet with me or exchange emails in a very timely manner. She prepares you for future classes. Be ready to work but I can't recommend her more.

Don't take this professor, especially if you're a nursing major. I am usually really good with anatomy, but this class seemed almost impossible to do well in. Tests are hard and didn't seem to align with her lectures. There's a lot of homework, but that isn't hard. She offered extra credit which was kind of her.
Tests every 3 weeks over every specific information and has no sympathy for students. Literally take anyone else
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Stephens is hands down my favorite lab professor at KSU! Do not get me wrong, this class is tough, but she explains things really well. She is understanding and caring about her students. TAKE HER

Professor Stephens is amazing. She went out of her way to make sure we understood the material and taught it with enthusiasm. Always accessible, always eager to help with encyclopedic level of knowledge on the subject. It was clear she genuinely wants her students to succeed. Exams aren't easy but they are fair. Rearrange your schedule to take her!
